message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel data representation method using convolutional neural networks (CNN) for data of different modalities. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), cs.MM (Multimedia), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). However, given that the paper focuses on learning a CNN model for each modality and regularizing the new representations in a common space, cs.LG and cs.CV are the most likely sub-categories. The use of CNNs also suggests that the paper could belong to cs.MM, while the focus on predicting class labels from the CNN representations suggests that it could belong to cs.AI and cs.NE.
